Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidKlaasen
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this excellent quite holtel. We had room 101 which is very spaceous with and wll appointed with 2 large windows looking out onto the Canal There is also an additional sitting room area which provided lost of extra space. The hotel is just 5 mins walk from the Bus Station Piazzle Roma which makes it very convenient to get to when arriving and it also means that it is very easy to find again becuase there are always sings pointing you back to the Piazzle Roma. The Fondamenta Rossa is very quiet because it is not on the main tourtis route and yet is it only a few minutes walk from the Campo St. Margherita which has a wonderful buzz and lost of bars and restaruants. It is also part of the main route to Academia. We will definately be staying there again on our next trip to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Flavia_Maximo
Reviews.Content: We stay just two nights in February (low season) and everything was great. Room: It was a double-bed room very cozy and clean and the bathroom was all new. Service: The staff (Paolo) was really polite and helpful. Gave us the city map and a lot of good advices. There isn't a breakfast hall and for this reason they serve breakfast in the bedroom. There isn't parking lot but they offer a discount in private one. There isn't internet. Location: Great location, close to bus and rail station. 20 mins walking to Piazza San Marco. Price: Good considering the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Elaina85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights in June/July last year. It is very close (well I guess everything is close on the island) to the main train and bus station and was very easy to find. The location is very quite away from all the touristy spots which was nice. The reception staff were very helpful and gave great suggestions on what to do in the little time we were there. The room was beautiful, looking out onto the canal outside. It was very spacious and comfortable. It had its own ensuite bathroom which was very clean. The breakfast was fine for us as we don't tend to have a big breakfast. You are also given a key so you can come and go as you pelase. Overall couldnt imagine staying anywhere else in Venice, was absoultly perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good !”
Reviews.Author: Erwan d
Reviews.Content: Convenient and very quiet rooms enough close and far from main sightseeings in Venice. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the hustle & bustle!”
Reviews.Author: kate_dafnis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on some of the other reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed! We didn't want to pay too much but really wanted to stay on the island. We stayed 4 nights and paid 159 EUROS for the week days and 179 EUROS for the weekend nights for a superior double room with a view of the canal. The room was on the top floor up 3 flights of stairs (no lift) but the size of the room and bathroom more than made up for it! It was a shabby chic room with a large double bed and large en-suite bathroom. The two windows overlooked the small canal outside which was a lovely plus, but not one I'm sure we'd pay the extra for again. I think the non-superior (i.e. no view) rooms were about 139 EUROS but not sure of their size. As this was our first trip to Venice however I'm glad we did! We did wake up to the sound of gondola and water taxi horns as they rounded the corner of the canal but this didn't bother us as we were eager to get out and about and explore more of the many sights Venice has to offer. The guy who ran the reception in the morning was a little brusque, however the guy who ran the desk at night could not have been more helpful. He always welcomed us warmly and offered lots of advice on what to do the next day, pointing out which vaporetta to get to travel to various places. His two top tips were: One to visit Murano - he gave us a card to present at one of the glass shops upon which we were ushered into the back-room factory to watch Antonio create a cat and a horse from the melted glass straight from the furnace. This was obviously a special treat and not one available to all. We also visited Burano where they make lace - this is a very pretty little island with colourful houses. Finally we visited the lido to see the old hotels such as Hotel du Bain - we were a little disappointed however as the public beach is overrun and a bit dirty and the large hotels own the other stretches of beach along the coast. I'd give this a miss unless you're willing to pay an extortionate amount to use one of the private beaches. The second tip was to give us free entry to the casino - there is a free water taxi from nearby which takes you to the casino entrance making sure you arrive in style. If you don't have a dinner jacket you can rent on there. We even won enough to take a midnight gondola trip which was just magical!! We'd decided previously we weren't going to shell out up to Â£150 to share a gondola with other tourists - or at best to ride alongside another whilst the gondoliers chatted in the queue through the canals. However this was something else - we managed to negotiate the fee to Â£100 and it was well worth it - we had the canals to ourselves with only the lapping water and the whispers of the gondolier pointing out Casanova's house for company while we sipped on little bottles of Prosecco we'd bought from a nearby shop :o) Other top tips would be to avoid buying drinks (alcoholic) with lunch - it doesn't seem to matter where you are they can cost as much as your food. We quickly realised it was nicer to buy a beer from one of the street vendors or cafe's with a bar on the street and take it to sit somewhere nice and enjoy the view after a long day's sightseeing. We did have a couple of glasses of Prosecco on our first evening in St. Marc's square which is a must - they cost 10 EUROS each, but a cup of tea cost 9! Another tip would be to eat like a local in Dorsodura - we sat in the far right corner of the main square (from the hotel) and shared the most delicious risotto I've ever had, with a couple of proseccos and a bottle of wine for about 60 EUROS - a bargain in Venice. We also were accompanied by a huge group of old Venetians and the men got up to serenade their wives - it was lovely!! My only negatives about the hotel were the breakfast was tea and a couple of rolls with spreadable cheese - we usually ended up buying elevenses somewhere as it wasn' t enough to fuel all the walking we were doing. Also, the shower didn't attach to the wall over the bath.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: LarnacaCy
Reviews.Content: So....just to be clear i am not someone that is picky BUT this hotel is NOT worth going to. We had a budget holiday in Italy but we thought to book somewhere nice and fancy for Venice since it was a romantic place...So i came up with this hotel which on OFFER was 100 euros per night.... The hotel was so not worth even 50 euros...the building was old, they had no lifts and we had to carry our bags on those tiny stairs up to 2nd floor. Ofcourse the staff did not suggest to help. The room was actually small and not that nice. The breakfast was .....ridiculous... The location was not hat bad as it was close to the train station BUT we had to carry our bags up and down the stairs of Venice bridges.... NO WI-FI, not even one to pay....So overall it doesnt worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ILnative
Reviews.Content: Hotels are expensive in Venice - its a given. This is a very good value option for those wanting an en-suite bathroom and to stay on the island itself. The room was clean and the bathroom was a little larger than some we have seen in Europe. The guys who works in the morning is ok but the guy who staffs the desk at night was great in helping us get oriented and with suggestions. In fact, he was a little hard to get away from some times :) Breakfast was adequate - you might want to bring a breakfast bar or something if you need fiber or protein... Location was good - about 12-15 min to Accademia, 20-25 to St. Marks and about 10 min to the train station. Probably one of the "less" touristy areas in Venice - nice to see some normal people going about their daily business. Very very quiet - make sure and pull the shutters shut and you won't hear a thing - but you might want to use an alarm then!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: samandtash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The room was quite spacious with a clean bathroom and a big comfy bed. There was also a safe and a fridge in the room which were very useful. Breakfast is simple but we still enjoyed having it brought to us in the room at the time we wanted. Being British and loving our cups of tea, we would have liked a kettle in the room! The location is ideal, walking distance from everywhere yet away from the busy tourist areas. The gentleman who runs the hotel was friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. He supplied us with a map and advised us on what to do and where to go. The Alla Corte Rossa feels more like a B&B than a hotel, very homely and cosy and even from the outside you wouldn't know it was a hotel! The front door is hidden away in an alley. Venice is beautiful and we would recommend the hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Adriabreu
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Venice so I have no other references to compare with. I liked the hotel, and I think I paid a fair value for it. My room was big with a nice view of the canal. It is not near San Marco - a positive aspect for me â€“ the center of everything in Venice. We took a Vaporeto in the first day and then walked from e to for every other destination. Venice is a happy and live place at night. Walking back to the hotel after a nice dinner was part of the fun! There were only 2 things that I didn't like about this hotel: My bathroom didn't have a curtain and the hot water lasted for only 5 minutes (lucky my wife who was always the first one to shower - in my turn, water was already cold and the bathroom already soaked). The other, thing: the guy who was at the reception, wasn`t the nicest one. He was not rude, but not helpful as well. The last night we ran into a different person at the reception an older gentle sir, who was very nice and kind. Bottom line: few problems, but no regrets â€“ once you start looking for hotels in Venice and realize there is nothing under 200 euros that worth it, Alla Corte Rossa is going to be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We should have never left”
Reviews.Author: chadgibbs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Alla Corte Rossa for four nights in July 2010. The room was clean, and larger than our similarly priced rooms in Rome and London. The hotel is located within walking distance from the train station. Google maps estimates a 12 minute walk, which sounds about right. A couple of bridges to navigate with your bags, but if you are able to carry your bags, a water taxi from the train station shouldn't be necessary. The hotel is in a great location. It is a very short walk to a square frequented by the local college students, so lively restaurants and bars are just around the corner, but not close enough to hear from your room. The south side of the island is also a very short walk away, featuring lots of restaurants with spectacular views. The hotel owner was incredible generous with his time, giving us maps and suggestions for food and things to see. He speaks great English, which was nice, because we spoke very little Italian. Breakfast is served in your room, and consists of breads, cheeses, coffee, tea, an cappuccino. You fill out your order the day before, including the time, and the next morning you get a knock on the door with breakfast. At least once a day since we left either my wife or I have said, "we should have never left Venice." Can't wait to go back, and we'll certainly stay at the Alla Corte Rossa.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: katefw
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend in Venice thanks to all the help, advise and guidance from the staff here. They went out of their way to make sure we made the most of our weekend away pointing us in the direction of great restaurants, bars and sights off the beaten track. The hotel is in a great location near the train/bus station, tucked away in a less toursity part of the city, but still with easy access to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian Hotel with Wonderful Owner”
Reviews.Author: StevePowrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alla Corta Rossa during our first trip to Venice. The hotel itself is ideally situated--it is near the train station, and within walking distance of most major sites. The room was on the small side, but it had a canal view. It was also quite clean, and the room was nicely decorated. The owner (I assume) is a wonderful man who really made our stay enjoyable. He is extremely knowledgable about Venice and shares his knowledge generously. (He also speaks english--a huge plus!). He gave up maps, directions, and history lessons on demand. He also serves breakfast in the rooms, which we really enjoyed. In addition there was tray of snacks in the room that was replenished daily. My only complaints are: the hot water heater wasn't great--I kept running out of hot water (although this may be a problem of Venice as a whole, not just the hotel), and I wish there had been wifi available. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel for its location, service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: joanainha22147
Reviews.Content: I always search for reviews before I finally decide where to stay on my vacations, and that's what I did before choosing Alla Corte Rossa. I wasn't disappointed at all, me and my husband loved this beautiful, cozy hotel! When we arrived we got room 201, very well decorated, modern bathroom and lovely canal view. Everyone was always so kind and helpful to us, giving us a map and invitations to Venice Casino. The breakfast was a bit unusual because it was served in our room. There is no breakfast room, witch I thought it was really strange, but in reality it turn down to be very good. In the room, there was a tray with cookies, jams, croissants, toasts and a paper where we can choose the drinks. The next day, at the chosen hour, they came to our room and gave us a delicious cappuccino, milk, coffee or orange juice, fresh bread, butter and cream cheese. The room is extremely quiet and clean, the location is fabulous, only a 10 minute walk from the train/vaporetto stop and a 20 minute walk to every hot spot in Venice. I'm sure you wont be disappointed if you choose to spend your vactions at this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: casildaroth
Reviews.Content: Not an amazing place (not really a hotel, but ratherr a B&B), but considering the venetian - and Italian - average, this place at least is not unreasonably expensive. Nice and quiet location, far enough from the most touristic routes. Nice rooms, in a non too heavy venetian style, and at least the Double superior, quite big and with a nice view. Lights, specially in the bathroom, are too weak. Breakfast is also quite disappointing. Very friendly the owner (the father), and ready to give a lot of precious advice. I would say the place is "ok". Nevertheless, I would highly recommend it if you're travelling to Venice. The best value for money you can get!

Reviews.Title: “glad we didn't stay in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: turrisi
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with the location of this hotel. We are really glad we didn't stay in the more expensive San Marco district. This hotel was surrounded by University areas and felt more local than being in San Marco. The areas close by had great restaurants at more realistic prices. The hosts were very friendly with advice and tips during our stay in Venice. The room was fantastic with period furniture and a fully functioning bathroom with great heating. Important things when traveling in Italy during November. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful price for a nice little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Graciegirl311
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel from the train station. We had small bags and the hotel is about an 8 minute walk from the train station...crossing about 4 bridges. This hotel is small and away from a lot of foot traffic. The hotel owners were very helpful in giving us a map and pointing out what we should see and how to get around in this unique city. There is no phone in the hotel rooms, just one coin operated pay phone at the base of the stairs. Also breakfast is very basic, but it is included in the price and they bring the food to your room. Venice was my favorite city in all of Italy and I thought this hotel was great especially for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Short impression”
Reviews.Author: Anezob
Reviews.Content: I am happy we choose this hotel. We have good memoirs from our visit to this place. Everything was excellent, except weather.

Reviews.Title: “mosquito infestation, among other problems”
Reviews.Author: rh53w
Reviews.Content: Many things here. First the good: - the owners, particularly the english-speaking father, were very friendly. they provided us with many decent suggestions of things to do, unbidden. even though i'd already been to venice before a couple of times and really didn't need any advice about the main sights, it still was very nice of them and they should get credit for it. -the location is easy for train/bus arrivals/departures. it's near the railway station and piazzale roma, so if you arrive by bus or train it's particularly convenient and within easy walking distance. don't be misled by the other reviews: venice is small, so once the bags are deposited pretty much any location is fairly convenient. but this is no less convenient than others, and it is quiet. again, don't be misled: anywhere outside of the san marco / rialto sites immediate area is going to be a pretty quiet hotel. then the bad: -the hotel has a serious mosquito problem. we got absolutely eaten alive, with the windows to our room closed. when we looked around, the room was swarming with mosquitos. I must have killed 10 of them, and they were all over. that happened nowhere else in venice; it was WITHOUT QUESTION a hotel issue. trust me on this one, it would be impossible for the staff not to know about it. and nobody said/did anything about it. it is almost unfathomable that they'd knowingly vend this room. in reality, this issue is the only reason i am writing this review. -the hot water was out and they neglected to apologize or say anything to warn. -the website shows tables with chairs next to each other against a brick wall and gives the impression of a nice dining area. there is none: you have breakfast in your room, which is good or bad depending on your point of view. forgetting about infestations or whatever for a moment, it means you need to know the night before when you, say, want your coffee in the morning. if you're good at predicting that, fine. otherwise it's annoying. also, the breakfast itself is a bunch of prepackaged breads and croissants: it's like what you'd get at a supermarket, not a bakery. not a particularly appetizing thing. also, breakfast is served from 8:30 - 10:30, so if you need to get up early and were hoping for a cappucino that's included in your stay, forget it. (not that i asked for an exception to this - and the older owner was nice enough that i get the impression he'd bring breakfast outside of stated hours - but per the posted timetable that's the deal). -there's no elevator, which for us was fine (young, in shape, etc). if this was a pension i'd give it a pass on this one, but for a hotel that charges EUR120 or so per night, you'd expect at least a mention of that on the website. all in all, you're probably better off staying in a cheap pension (same stuff for less money and the priceless addition of no bugs) - but the real solution is just to use one of the countless other hotels in venice that are basically the same as this one, charge the same as this one, and have a location as convenient as this one, but don't have any of the many problems this one has. especially the mosquitos - everything above is forgivable, to me, except for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Flyingphilt
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was probably the only minor dissapointment as it is served in the room (there is no public area in the hote|)and barely adequate if nothing special. However the real delight of the Alla Corte Rossa is the great location an easy walk to the railway and bus stations and a short walk to all the main attractions of Venice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: AstridRotterdam
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Venice is an excellent recommendation for people who like to stay in a quiet place that is close to all interesting places of Venice. Corte Rossa is a small family-run hotel with beautiful rooms and excellent service. The hotel is situated next to a quiet canal (just a few minutes walk form Piazzala Roma)from where you can easily walk to all important sites in Venice. Breakfast is served in the room and consists of tea, coffee, juice, fresh rolls, toast, cheese, jam and a croissant. Rooms are clean and spacious ; our room could even be called big, with a high ceiling and was at the top floor with a beautiful view over the canals. The owner and his son are very friendly and helpfull. This hotel was partly responsible for making our trip to Venice unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: fz1fazer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short walk from the bus/train station and is easy enough to find, upon arrival we were greeted by Paul who ran the hotel with his son David. Paul was amazingly helpful and gave a us good advice and directions etc, this really made the whole trip a memorable experience. The hotel is situated in a fairly quiet area, the room was clean and tidy with a good sized bathroom and shower, breakfast was fairly basic but adequate. I would certainly recommend the Alla Corte Rossa, I booked with last minute.com and for the price I could only find hotels 20-30km outside of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “bed no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonitalia
Reviews.Content: Positive: location, large comfortable bed, clean and decent showeroom. Negative: Small room packed with furniture, noisy electric meter in room buzzing all night. BREAKFAST!!! Breakfast was only prepacked biscuits and coffee similiar to a motorway service. No fruit, no cereal, continental food stuffs no breakfast in essence. Perhaps if they want to offer such a limited service it would be more honest to simply put a kettle and biscuits etc in the room. we only saw staff on arrival for couple of minutes and at breakfast (!). There wasn't any one available at our departure. Very adhoc. There are lots of great hotels and b&b in Venice don't spoil your visit by booking this one.

HotelInfo.Name: Alla Corte Rossa
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 2518 - Fondamenta Rossa, 30123 Venice, Italy
